Package edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre

Class ProblemBuilder

java.lang.Object
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.ProblemBuilder
public class ProblemBuilder extends Object
A problem builder assists in defining a planning problem by enforcing requirements on the various parts needed to define a problem.
Author:
Stephen G. Ware

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ProblemBuilder(Problem problem)
    Constructs a new problem builder that will begin with all the definitions in the provided problem and can be used to define a new problem which is an extension or modification of that problem.
    ProblemBuilder(String name, Universe universe)
    Constructs a new empty problem builder with a given name and universe.

  • Constructor Details

    • ProblemBuilder

      public ProblemBuilder(Problem problem)
      Constructs a new problem builder that will begin with all the definitions in the provided problem and can be used to define a new problem which is an extension or modification of that problem.
      Parameters:
      problem - a pre-defined problem

    • ProblemBuilder

      public ProblemBuilder(String name, Universe universe)
      Constructs a new empty problem builder with a given name and universe. All parts of the problem will be initialized to default or empty values.
      Parameters:
      name - the problem name
      universe - the universe of types and entities

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the current problem name.
      Returns:
      the name

    • setName

      public String setName(String name)
      Sets the name of the problem.
      Parameters:
      name - the new name
      Returns:
      the name

    • getUniverse

      public Universe getUniverse()
      Returns the universe of types and entities being used in the current problem.
      Returns:
      the universe

    • getFluent

      public Fluent getFluent(Signature signature)
      Returns a fluent defined in the current problem based on the given signature. The signature does not need to match a fluent explicitly defined in the current problem; it can match a fluent implicitly defined by a template. Any types and entities in the signature will be replaced with types and entities of the same name in the current problem's universe, if they exist.
      Parameters:
      signature - the signature of the fluent to find
      Returns:
      the defined fluent
      Throws:
      FormatException - if no fluent matching this signature is defined

    • getFluents

      public ImmutableSet<Fluent> getFluents()
      Returns a set of all currently defined fluents.
      Returns:
      the fluents

    • defineFluent

      public Fluent defineFluent(Signature signature, Type type, String comment)
      Defines a new fluent. If the signature contains variables, this will implicitly define all possible ground versions of the fluent.
      Parameters:
      signature - the new fluent's signature
      type - the type of value the new fluent can be assigned
      comment - a comment to associate with the fluent
      Returns:
      the newly defined fluent
      Throws:
      FormatException - if the signature matches an already defined fluent or if it implicitly defines a fluent already defined

    • getEvent

      public Event getEvent(Signature signature)
      Returns an event defined in the current problem based on the given signature. The signature does not need to match an event explicitly defined in the current problem; it can match an event implicitly defined by a template. Any types and entities in the signature will be replaced with types and entities of the same name in the current problem's universe, if they exist.
      Parameters:
      signature - the signature of the event to find
      Returns:
      the defined event
      Throws:
      FormatException - if no event matching this signature is defined

    • getAction

      public Action getAction(Signature signature)
      Returns an action defined in the current problem based on the given signature. The signature does not need to match an action explicitly defined in the current problem; it can match an action implicitly defined by a template. Any types and entities in the signature will be replaced with types and entities of the same name in the current problem's universe, if they exist.
      Parameters:
      signature - the signature of the action to find
      Returns:
      the defined action
      Throws:
      FormatException - if no action matching this signature is defined

    • getActions

      public ImmutableSet<Action> getActions()
      Returns a set of all currently defined actions.
      Returns:
      the actions

    • defineAction

      public Action defineAction(Signature signature, Expression precondition, Expression effect, Iterable<? extends Parameter> consenting, Mapping<Expression> observing, String comment)
      Defines a new action. If the signature contains variables, this will implicitly define all possible ground versions of the action.
      Parameters:
      signature - the new action's signature
      precondition - the new action's precondition
      effect - the new action's effect
      consenting - the new action's set of consenting characters
      observing - the new action's observation function
      comment - a comment to associate with the action
      Returns:
      the newly defined action
      Throws:
      FormatException - if the signature matches an already defined action or if it implicitly defines an action already defined

    • getTrigger

      public Trigger getTrigger(Signature signature)
      Returns a trigger defined in the current problem based on the given signature. The signature does not need to match a trigger explicitly defined in the current problem; it can match a trigger implicitly defined by a template. Any types and entities in the signature will be replaced with types and entities of the same name in the current problem's universe, if they exist.
      Parameters:
      signature - the signature of the trigger to find
      Returns:
      the defined trigger
      Throws:
      FormatException - if no trigger matching this signature is defined

    • getTriggers

      public ImmutableSet<Trigger> getTriggers()
      Returns a set of all currently defined triggers.
      Returns:
      the triggers

    • defineTrigger

      public Trigger defineTrigger(Signature signature, Expression precondition, Expression effect, String comment)
      Defines a new trigger. If the signature contains variables, this will implicitly define all possible ground versions of the trigger.
      Parameters:
      signature - the new trigger's signature
      precondition - the new trigger's precondition
      effect - the new trigger's effect
      comment - a comment to associate with the trigger
      Returns:
      the newly defined trigger
      Throws:
      FormatException - if the signature matches an already defined trigger or if it implicitly defines a trigger already defined

    • getInitialState

      public Expression getInitialState()
      Returns a logical expression used to set the initial state, which should define the values of all fluents in a problem, including any character beliefs that do not match the true world state.
      Returns:
      the expression that sets the initial state

    • addToInitialState

      public Expression addToInitialState(Expression expression)
      Adds an expression to the initial state of the problem. The expression is first converted to an effect, then the new initial state expression becomes a conjunction of the current expression and the new expression.
      Parameters:
      expression - the new expression to add to the initial state
      Returns:
      the new initial state expression
      Throws:
      FormatException - if the expression cannot be converted to an effect

    • getUtility

      public Expression getUtility()
      Returns the currently defined author utility function.
      Returns:
      the utility function

    • setUtility

      public Expression setUtility(Expression expression)
      Sets the author utility function. Utility expressions should be of type number, but if an expression of type boolean is given, it will automatically be converted into a conditional numeric expression like so: if expression then 1 else 0.
      Parameters:
      expression - the new author utility function
      Returns:
      the author utility function

    • getUtility

      public Expression getUtility(Character character)
      Returns the currently defined utility function for a given character.
      Parameters:
      character - the character whose utility function is desired
      Returns:
      the character's utility function

    • getUtilities

      public Mapping<Expression> getUtilities()
      Returns a mapping representing the utility functions of all characters in the universe.
      Returns:
      the mapping

    • setUtility

      public Expression setUtility(Character character, Expression expression)
      Sets the utility function for a given character. Utility expressions should be of type number, but if an expression of type boolean is given, it will automatically be converted into a conditional numeric expression like so: if expression then 1 else 0.
      Parameters:
      character - the character whose utility is being defined
      expression - the new utility function
      Returns:
      the utility function

    • getComment

      public String getComment()
      Returns the current comment associated with the problem.
      Returns:
      the comment

    • setComment

      public String setComment(String comment)
      Sets the comment associated with the problem.
      Parameters:
      comment - the new comment
      Returns:
      the comment
